data.text: @SakuraCon Thanks for the clarification, looking forward to attending.
@XBurritoPandaX We will not be accepting at at-home rapid tests. The results will need to be within 72 hours of testing, so the dates you mentioned would be perfect!
@SakuraCon Also, traveling up from Oregon, just to clarify, if I get tested on the 13th, get results on the 14th, and present them on the 15th at the convention, that'll be accepted for entry, right?

@SakuraCon What exactly does "laboratory issues" entail? Will it be accepted as long as it's not a home test? For instance, will a negative test from the local Walgreens be accepted, or do I have to get one from the Hospital, or would both work?
@SakuraCon Ok good because I do have a digital record of what I got and on what dates.
@AxelGilligan A great question and yes! As long as you have a picture of a valid card or a digital record that will be fine.
@Vipes3 Keeping Sakura-Con safe for all while enjoying the convention is our main priority, we hope to see you there!

@SakuraCon *deafening cheer*

YES! Thank you for continuing to take precautions!
@SakuraCon I don't have a card (as I washed mine) but I do have proof of vaccination, is that going to be acceptable?
